Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/litigation/litreleases/2010/lr21374.htm

Description: On October 14, 2003, a Notice of Violation and Proposed Imposition of Civil Penalties in the amount of $90,000 was issued for three Severity Level III problems involving: (1) the failure to keep 13 public radiation doses within NRC limits ($78,000); (2) the willful failure to perform radiation surveys, and failure to maintain control of a radioactive well-logging source ($6,000); and (3) the failure to follow emergency procedures and secure the source after it was found ($6,000).
Info Source: https://www.nrc.gov/reading-rm/doc-collections/enforcement/actions/materials/ea03010.html

Description: Cameron International Corporation, a Houston, Texas-based supplier of goods and services for the oil and gas industries, and a subsidiary of Schlumberger Limited agreed to pay $1,423,766 to settle its potential civil liability for apparent violations of Ukraine-related sanctions arising from its provision of services to the Russian energy firm Gazprom-Neft Shelf for an Arctic offshore oil project.
Info Source: https://home.treasury.gov/system/files/126/20210927_Cameron.pdf
